comment.author: 64288588@N05
comment._content: From www.cwgc.org www.cwgc.org/find-war-dead/casualty/772855/AIKMAN,%20WILLIAM AIKMAN, WILLIAM Rank:Private Service No:240797 Date of Death:01/07/1916 Regiment/Service:West Yorkshire Regiment (Prince of Wales's Own) (2834). 1st/6th Bn. Panel Reference Pier and F e 2 A 2 C and 2 D. Memorial THIEPVAL MEMORIAL Additional Information: Son of Mrs. S. A. Aikman, of 29, Exeter St., Bradford. William was born in 1895 in Bradford. At the time of the 1911 census he was 16 and living with his family at 23 Lofthouse St, Bradford. He was a Butcher. His parents were Robert (55) and Sarah Ann Aikman (45). Robert was an out-of-work Stone Mason. William had an older brother, James, aged 21. And a younger one, John, aged 4 in 1911. The 1901 census reveals two more brothers, Robert then aged 8 and Thomas aged 1.
